runs.comm: full on leg stump, clips the pad and bobbles through to the keeper
hint of width outside off, square driven firmly but straight to point
edged, but short! A firm-footed drive outside off, hint of swing, finds a thick edge but doesn't carry to Sammy at first slip
uses his feet, comes at the bowler, and clips a full delivery firmly through midwicket. Just enough on the ball for it to each the rope
down the pitch again, it's wide outside off, sweetly driven through the covers but there's a sweeper out
back of a length, outside off, cut firmly to point
starts very short and pretty wide, Lumb chases and upper cuts over the slip...one bounce to third man
fuller this time, but still quite wide outside off, cut to point
back of a length, banged in at hood pace, 142kph/88mph, beats Lumb's under edge as he tries to pull
short and wide outside off, that's called...early nerves, perhaps
pitches this one up, but's greeted by a terrific straight drive which zings off the middle past mid-off
short again and this time pulled through midwicket, deep square-leg can't get around so it's back-to-back boundaries. Lumb enjoying the extra pace.
short and wide, think he attemped a slower ball as well, Lumb goes up and over point and it almost has enough to carry the boundary
now Hales is using his feet, it doesn't strike the middle and but the outfield is very quick and the ball beats mid-off straight down the ground
excellent shot, full outside off and driven with precision through the covers
opens the face to this full delivery, drives square to point
full at the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
straight down the ground...another clean strike by Lumb, hitting through the line of this full delivery
keeping it full, driven along the ground this time and to the right of mid-off
full and straight, prodded to the off side
nicely driven, opens the face a touch but finds cover
goes down on one knee, sweeps hard and gets it behind square...think he was actually aiming more midwicket
that's bigger! Not quite a Chris Gayle, but still worth six. Goes down on his back knee again and slog sweeps a length delivery over deep square-leg
England's fifty up in the fourth over, is this the revolution? Throws his hands through line of a full ball outside off and it takes a big thick edge through short third man
misses his sweep this time
full outside off, gone with a hit at the non-striker's end! Charles dived to make a good stop at point, Lumb had committed to the single and would not have been in the frame
full on the stumps, slower ball, flicked to midwicket
shorter this time, and some width, back-cut fine of backward point to third man
short and wide, a cutter this time, Hales picks out point
he's finding the middle, but also the fielder...this time he picks out cover
full on off stump, nicely placed as he works it through midwicket with a flick of his bottom hand
driven off the back foot to cover
paddled round the corner to short fine-leg
short of a length, Hales on the back foot and works through straight midwicket...Samuels is quick to prevent a second
driven off the back foot, again to cover
this one turns, from quite a short length, Lumb can't beat the off side
opts to go leg side this time, it's short again, pulled through midwicket...a skimmer
back of a length on off stump, pushed square through the off side
full outside off, driven to the cover sweeper

out of the ground! Now England have lost a ball. Dropped in short, Hales sees it early and pulls it high and handsome over deep square-leg. Bounces off the roof of the Greenidge-Haynes stand and, perhaps, into the street.
yorker, good comeback, dug out to the leg side
full at leg stump, pushed down to long-on
keeping it full now after that massive six, but this is nicely played through the off side to the right of long-off and that raises a superb fifty for Lumb off 27 balls
full outside off, driven square to point whose fumble allows the single
technically a drop as Lumb drills his straight drive back at Sammy who sticks his hands up in his follow through. He's held some stunners, so will be upset to miss that even though it was flying
driven square to point
cuts and misses, beaten on the top edge, good take by Ramdin
comes forward and drives to cover
full and straight, tucked down to long-on...first over of the match without a boundary
starts full this time, pushed down to long-off
slower ball, outside off, Lumb is early on his shot, aiming square through the off side, and gets beaten
length delivery, heaved down the ground, one bounce to long-on
a bouncer, over off stump, and it's too short
bottom edge on a pull, perhaps not quite as short as Hales thought, it scoots past his stumps to short fine-leg
good fielding by long-off, Simmons, running around the boundary to cut off a well-timed drive which was skimming over the outfield...career-best for Lumb in T20Is
driven square to deep cover
powerful through the off side, comes out of his crease and drives on the up through the covers
in the air, but short of deep cover...intentionally lofted by Lumb, think he was aiming straighter. Charles made good ground, but couldn't quite get under it
driven to cover inside the circle
he moved across his crease, Sammy saw him and sent the ball wider outside off, Lumb drove to long-off
full, picked up with a lot of bottom hand high into the leg side and it pitches just short of the deep square-leg boundary
back of a length, driven to cover
full and straight, good delivery, jabbed down the ground off the toe end
hint of swing back into Hales, going for another yorker, worked to the leg side
slower ball, drags it down outside off but beats Lumb...cut his fingers across it
angling into leg stump, flicked to midwicket

gets underneath one, aiming over the leg side, goes miles (and miles, and miles) into the air. Takes an age to come down, Bravo eventually calls for it at cover after a brief glance to an approaching team-mate and holds his nerve well. First wicket for Cottrell
full again, good comeback from Cottrell, driven down to long-off
round the wicket, punched to long-on to bring up England's 100
tucks a length delivery out to deep midwicket
gets a bottom edge on a pull and it dribbles to short fine-leg
short outside off, cut to cover off the front foot
fuller and he comes forward, drives to cover...another dot
good stuff from Samuels, this slides into Morgan from round the wicket and he just prods to the off side
terrific yorker, good pace, Hales jabs down and the ball runs to backward point
goes short to Morgan, pulled out to deep square-leg
full outside off, clubbed down the ground
oh, what a wonderful strike. That's a flat six as Morgan drives this full delivery over long-off. Such power from his whippy backlift and fast hands
short, at the body, paddled around the corner to fine leg

picks out long-on...Cottrell salutes another wicket with his final delivery. Back of a length, Hales plays a flat-batted pull, probably aiming more midwicket, and picks out Simmons who took a few paces to his left
full and tucked through midwicket
goes outside leg stump and down the pitch, almost gets into trouble as he has to reach for the ball and hoicks it through midwicket
opens the face and finds backward point
short outside off, gets away with it as Buttler picks out cover
fuller at the stumps, Samuels doing well, pushed to the off side
can't get this away either, no pace to work with, played back to the bowler
lovely slower ball, back of a length, it grips off the surface and beats Morgan as he opens the face
full outside off, driven to deep cover
great use of the boot! Buttler drove a full ball straight down the pitch, Bravo stuck out his right foot
slower ball outside off, Buttler plays too early and it takes an inside edge to the leg side
pushes early at a full slower delivery, almost pops a catch to cover then is almost run out
tight on the stumps, just drops his bat to the ball and it runs gently to backward point
a lovely piece of placement, comes down the pitch on the line of leg stump and lofts it over cover with use of his bottom hand
taken on the pad as he goes to sweep
goes across outside off, then misses another slog sweep
shorter, and Morgan picks out deep midwicket. Not at his best today. Cramp for room, couldn't extend his arms into the shot therefore couldn't generate the required power.
pushed into the off side
that's the legspinner, and Bopara would have been run out after pushing to point and stuttering over the single
full at the stumps, nudged through midwicket and this time there's some excellent running
worked down to long-on
gets underneath this too much, like Lumb earlier, and only gets height rather than distance...Sammy does really well to hold on at cover as he tumbles back having run in a touch too far
slower ball, keeping it full, dabbed to the off side

fantastic delivery, beautiful slower ball. Complete confounds Stokes who plays all around it, the ball grips and goes past the inside edge to take out middle stump. He did Moeen with one in the previous match. So skilful
another slower ball, outside off, Moeen is slightly early but it loops into space through midwicket
pushed across outside off, played square to point
full and straight, straightens on Bopara who pushes a single to cover
lovely bowling, this one spins and bounces to beat the outside edge
that's a bonus for England, slips down the leg side and Ramdin can't gather it...five to the total
lunges forward, ball runs off the face to short third man
more sharp spin, takes Bopara high on the pads
superb finish for Narine, this is just dabbed to the off side and they can't even take a single

this could be very sharp work from Santokie, but it's a valuable dot ball either way. Another top yorker, Moeen actually made it into one by coming down the pitch, jabbed to the leg side and Santokie followed through then flicked the ball into the stumps. Moeen stretches for the crease, but where was the dive? That's a bit dozy.
another dot ball, slower ball that bounces from short of a length and takes the thigh pad
fantastic bowling, full and straight, just runs off the face to backward point
touch shorter, opens the blade to short third man
outside off this time, Jordan tries to slog sweep but misses the ball completely
a yorker outside off, he jabs over the top it, excellent take by Ramdin. Just one off the penultimate over. That's exceptional (not from the batting side, of course. It's rubbish from them)
back of a length, a cutter, he goes up and over the off side wide of deep cover
this one finds the middle! Strong shot from hometown boy Jordan, just gave himself a hint of room and drove a length ball over the deep cover boundary
even better this time, Bravo getting his length wrong, not full enough and Jordan drives on the up cover extra cover
three in a row! He's got some power. Dropped shorter by Bravo and it's crunched over deep midwicket. That was even into the wind. Still went miles.
fuller, a length ball, lucky not to cost him as Jordan misses his flay

that might be the best of the lot! A short-arm jab-drive, it's length again, sails over the long-off boundary. He then turns, sticks his bat under his arm and strolls off. Terrific finish. Poor over from Bravo.
